new Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlobClient : Uri * Azure.AzureSasCredential * Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlobClientOptions -> Azure.Storage.Blobs.BlobClient

Docs.param: A referencing the blob that includes the name of the account, the name of the container, and the name of the blob. This is likely to be similar to "https://{account_name}.blob.core.windows.net/{container_name}/{blob_name}". Must not contain shared access signature, which should be passed in the second parameter.
The shared access signature credential used to sign requests.
Optional client options that define the transport pipeline policies for authentication, retries, etc., that are applied to every request.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Docs.remarks: This constructor should only be used when shared access signature needs to be updated during lifespan of this client.

Docs.param: A containing the content to upload.
Whether the upload should overwrite any existing blobs. The default value is false.
Optional to propagate notifications that the operation should be cancelled.
Docs.summary:
The operation creates a new block blob or throws if the blob already exists. Setting to true allows updating the content of an existing block blob. Updating an existing block blob overwrites any existing metadata on the blob.
For partial block blob updates and other advanced features, please see . To create or modify page or append blobs, please see or .
For more information, see
Put Blob.
Docs.returns: A describing the state of the updated block blob.
Docs.remarks: A will be thrown if a failure occurs.

MemberSignature.Usage: blobClient.Upload (content, httpHeaders, metadata, conditions, progressHandler, accessTier, transferOptions, cancellationToken)

Docs.param: A containing the content to upload.
Optional standard HTTP header properties that can be set for the block blob.
Optional custom metadata to set for this block blob.
Optional to add conditions on the creation of this new block blob.
Optional to provide progress updates about data transfers.
Optional Indicates the tier to be set on the blob.
Optional to configure parallel transfer behavior.
Optional to propagate notifications that the operation should be cancelled.
Docs.summary:
The operation overwrites the contents of the blob, creating a new block blob if none exists. Overwriting an existing block blob replaces any existing metadata on the blob.
Set access conditions through to avoid overwriting existing data.
For partial block blob updates and other advanced features, please see . To create or modify page or append blobs, please see or .
For more information,
Put Blob.
Docs.returns: A describing the state of the updated block blob.
Docs.remarks: A will be thrown if a failure occurs.

MemberSignature.Usage: blobClient.Upload (path, httpHeaders, metadata, conditions, progressHandler, accessTier, transferOptions, cancellationToken)

Docs.param: A file path containing the content to upload.
Optional standard HTTP header properties that can be set for the block blob.
Optional custom metadata to set for this block blob.
Optional to add conditions on the creation of this new block blob.
Optional to provide progress updates about data transfers.
Optional Indicates the tier to be set on the blob.
Optional to configure parallel transfer behavior.
Optional to propagate notifications that the operation should be cancelled.
Docs.summary:
The operation overwrites the contents of the blob, creating a new block blob if none exists. Overwriting an existing block blob replaces any existing metadata on the blob.
Set access conditions through to avoid overwriting existing data.
For partial block blob updates and other advanced features, please see . To create or modify page or append blobs, please see or .
For more information, see
Put Blob.
Docs.returns: A describing the state of the updated block blob.
Docs.remarks: A will be thrown if a failure occurs.
